articles.title: Ingilizce Konusan Partnerinizin Ailesiyle Tanisma
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Partnerinizin ailesiyle ilk kez tanismak heyecan verici ama stresli olabilir. Eger aile Ingilizce konusuyorsa, dogru ifadeleri bilmek ve kulturel farkliliklari anlamak bu deneyimi cok daha kolaylastirir. Bu rehberde, basarili bir aile tanisma icin gereken her seyi bulacaksiniz.

## Ilk Karsilasma

<PhraseOfDay
  word="It's so nice to finally meet you"
  translation="Sonunda sizinle tanismak cok guzel"
  pronunciation="its so nays tu fay-ne-li mit yu"
  context="Ilk tanismada en uygun acilis cumlesi"
/>

### Selamlar

<VocabCard
  word="I've heard so much about you"
  translation="Hakkƒ±nƒ±zda cok sey duydum"
  pronunciation="ayv herd so mac e-baut yu"
  example="Mrs. Johnson, I've heard so much about you. It's wonderful to meet you."
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **Pleased to meet you** | plizd tu mit yu | Tanistigimiza memnunum |
| **Hello, I'm [isim]** | he-lo, aym [isim] | Merhaba, ben [isim] |
| **[Partner] has told me so much about you** | [partner] hez told mi so mac e-baut yu | [Partner] sizden cok bahsetti |
| **Thank you for having me** | tenk yu for he-ving mi | Beni kabul ettiginiz icin tesekkurler |

<CultureTip title="El Sikisma ve Sariima" flag="üá¨üáß">
Ingiliz kulturunde ilk tanismada genellikle el sikilir. Amerikalilar daha sicak olabilir ve sarilabilir. Ailenin yaklasimini takip edin - onlar sarilƒ±rsa siz de sarilƒ±n, el uzatirlarsa siz de el uzatƒ±n.
</CultureTip>

## Aile Uyelerini Hitap Etme

### Hitap Sekilleri

<VocabCard
  word="Mr. and Mrs. [Soyisim]"
  translation="Bay ve Bayan [Soyisim]"
  pronunciation="mis-ter end mi-siz [soyisim]"
  example="It's nice to meet you, Mr. and Mrs. Smith."
/>

| Durum | Hitap | Ornek |
|-------|-------|-------|
| Resmi (ilk tanisma) | Mr./Mrs./Ms. + Soyisim | Mr. Johnson |
| Izin verdiklerinde | Isim | John, Susan |
| Daha yakin olduktan sonra | Mom, Dad (Amerika) | Thanks, Mom! |

<CultureTip title="Isim Kullanimi" flag="üá∫üá∏">
Amerikalilar genellikle ilk isimleri hizla kullanmaya baslar. "Please, call me John" derlerse, artik John diyebilirsiniz. Ingilizler biraz daha resmi kalabilir. Her zaman onlarin onerdigini takip edin.
</CultureTip>

## Hediye Gotirme

<VocabCard
  word="I brought this for you"
  translation="Bunu size getirdim"
  pronunciation="ay brot dis for yu"
  example="I brought this wine for you. I hope you like it."
/>

### Uygun Hediyeler

| Hediye | Ingilizce | Not |
|--------|-----------|-----|
| Sarap | Wine | Aksam yemegine uygun |
| Cicek | Flowers | Ev sahibi icin klasik |
| Cikolata | Chocolates | Her zaman hos |
| Turkiye'den bir sey | Something from Turkey | Kulturel paylasim |

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **This is for you** | dis iz for yu | Bu sizin icin |
| **I hope you like it** | ay hop yu layk it | Umarin seversiniz |
| **It's from my hometown** | its from may houm-taun | Memleketimden |
| **[Partner] told me you like...** | [partner] told mi yu layk | [Partner] ... sevdiginizi soyledi |

## Sofra Basi Sohbeti

### Konusma Baslaticlari

<VocabCard
  word="How did you two meet?"
  translation="Siz ikiniz nasil tani≈ütiniz?"
  pronunciation="hav did yu tu mit"
  example="I'd love to hear the story - how did you two meet?"
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **What do you do for work?** | vat du yu du for vork | Ne is yapiyorsunuz? |
| **How long have you lived here?** | hav long hev yu livd hir | Ne kadardir burada yasiyorsunuz? |
| **This area is beautiful** | dis e-ri-a iz byu-ti-ful | Burasi cok guzel |
| **Tell me about your family** | tel mi e-baut yor fe-mi-li | Ailenizi anlatin |

### Yemek Hakkinda

<VocabCard
  word="This is delicious"
  translation="Bu cok lezzetli"
  pronunciation="dis iz di-li-sos"
  example="This roast is delicious! Could I have the recipe?"
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **Everything looks wonderful** | ev-ri-ting luks van-der-ful | Her sey harika gorunuyor |
| **You're an amazing cook** | yor en e-mey-zing kuk | Harika bir ascisiniz |
| **Could I have some more?** | kud ay hev sam mor | Biraz daha alabilir miyim? |
| **What's in this?** | vats in dis | Bunun icinde ne var? |

## Partneriniz Hakkinda Konusma

<VocabCard
  word="You raised an amazing person"
  translation="Harika bir insan yetistirmissiniz"
  pronunciation="yu reyzd en e-mey-zing per-sen"
  example="I have to say, you raised an amazing person. I'm very lucky."
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **[Partner] makes me so happy** | [partner] meyks mi so he-pi | [Partner] beni cok mutlu ediyor |
| **I love your son/daughter** | ay lav yor san/do-ter | Oglunuzu/Kizinizi seviyorum |
| **We take care of each other** | vi teyk ker ov ic a-der | Birbirimize bakiyoruz |
| **[Partner] talks about you all the time** | [partner] toks e-baut yu ol de taym | [Partner] sizden surekli bahsediyor |

<CultureTip title="Iliskinizi Anlatma" flag="üá¨üáß">
Aileler genellikle iliskinizin ne kadar ciddi oldugunu anlamak ister. Acik ve samimi olun ama cok fazla ozel detay vermeyin. "We're very happy together" gibi genel ifadeler uygundur.
</CultureTip>

## Kendinizi Tanƒ±tma

### Kariyer ve Yasam

<VocabCard
  word="I work as a..."
  translation="... olarak calisiyorum"
  pronunciation="ay vork ez e"
  example="I work as a software engineer in Istanbul."
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **I'm from Turkey** | aym from ter-ki | Turkiye'denim |
| **I've been living in [sehir] for [sure]** | ayv bin li-ving in [sehir] for [sure] | [Sure]dir [sehir]'de yasiyorum |
| **I studied [alan] at university** | ay sta-did [alan] et yu-ni-ver-si-ti | Universitede [alan] okudum |
| **My family is from [yer]** | may fe-mi-li iz from [yer] | Ailem [yer]'den |

### Hobileriniz

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **In my free time, I like to...** | in may fri taym, ay layk tu | Bos zamanimda ... yapmaktan hoslaniyorum |
| **We enjoy... together** | vi en-coy ... tu-ge-der | Birlikte ... yapmaktan zevk aliyoruz |
| **One of my hobbies is...** | van ov may ho-biz iz | Hobilerimden biri ... |

## Yardim Teklif Etme

<VocabCard
  word="Can I help with anything?"
  translation="Bir konuda yardim edebilir miyim?"
  pronunciation="ken ay help vid e-ni-ting"
  example="Dinner was wonderful. Can I help with the dishes?"
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **Let me help you** | let mi help yu | Size yardim edeyim |
| **I can set the table** | ay ken set de tey-bul | Masayi hazƒ±rlayabilirim |
| **Shall I clear the plates?** | sel ay klir de pleyts | Tabaklari toplamami ister misiniz? |
| **I'd be happy to help** | ayd bi he-pi tu help | Yardim etmekten mutluluk duyarim |

<CultureTip title="Yardim Teklifi" flag="üá∫üá∏">
Yardim teklif etmek iyi bir izlenim bƒ±rakir, ancak "No, no, you're our guest!" (Hayir, hayir, siz misafirimizsiniz!) derlerse ustelemeyin. Bir veya iki kez teklif edin, sonra kabul edin.
</CultureTip>

## Vedala≈üma

<VocabCard
  word="Thank you for a wonderful evening"
  translation="Harika bir aksam icin tesekkurler"
  pronunciation="tenk yu for e van-der-ful iv-ning"
  example="Thank you for a wonderful evening. I had a great time."
/>

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **It was lovely meeting you** | it voz lav-li mi-ting yu | Sizinle tanismak cok guzeldi |
| **I hope to see you again soon** | ay hop tu si yu e-gen sun | Yakinda tekrar gorusmeyi umuyorum |
| **Thank you for your hospitality** | tenk yu for yor hos-pi-te-li-ti | Konuk severliginiz icin tesekkurler |
| **Let's do this again** | lets du dis e-gen | Bunu tekrar yapalim |
| **Drive safe** | drayv seyf | Dikkatli surun |

## Zor Durumlarda

### Anlamadiginizda

| Ingilizce | Okunusu | Turkce |
|-----------|---------|--------|
| **I'm sorry, I didn't catch that** | aym so-ri, ay didnt kec det | Ozur dilerim, anlayamadim |
| **Could you repeat that?** | kud yu ri-pit det | Tekrar eder misiniz? |
| **I'm still learning English** | aym stil ler-ning ing-lis | Hala Ingilizce ogreniyorum |
| **My English isn't perfect, but...** | may ing-lis iznt per-fekt, bat | Ingilizcem mukemmel degil ama... |

### Hata Yaptiginizda

<VocabCard
  word="I hope I didn't offend anyone"
  translation="Kimseyi kirrmadigimi umuyorum"
  pronunciation="ay hop ay didnt o-fend e-ni-van"
  example="I'm sorry if I said something wrong. I hope I didn't offend anyone."
/>

Ailenin kulturel farkliklarinizi anlamasi muhtemeldir. Samimi ve saygilik oldugunuz surece kucuk hatalar affedilir.

## Pratik Ipuclari

1. **Onceden hazirlanin**: Temel ifadeleri ezberleyin
2. **Sorular sorun**: Insanlar kendileri hakkinda konusmayi sever
3. **Gulumseyin**: Evrensel bir dil
4. **Dikkatli dinleyin**: Anlama, konusmaktan onemli
5. **Partnerinizden yardim isteyin**: Sƒ±kisƒ±nca size yardim edebilir

## √ñƒürenmeye Devam Et

- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Telaffuz](/learn/tr/en/english-pronunciation-guide/)** - Sesleri √∂ƒürenin
- **[Temel ƒ∞ngilizce ƒ∞fadeler](/learn/tr/en/english-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - Pratik ileti≈üim
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Zor mu?](/learn/tr/en/is-english-hard-to-learn/)** - D√ºr√ºst analiz
- **[ƒ∞ngilizce Selamla≈ümalar](/learn/tr/en/english-greetings-farewells/)** - Temel konu≈üma

articles.title: German Questions - How to Ask Anything
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import ConjugationTable from '@components/ConjugationTable.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

Asking questions is essential for connecting with your partner in any language. From "How was your day?" to "Will you marry me?", questions drive conversations and deepen relationships. Let's master German questions together, so you can ask anything and understand everything.

## Two Types of German Questions

German has two main question types:
1. **Yes/No Questions** (Ja/Nein-Fragen) - Can be answered with yes or no
2. **W-Questions** (W-Fragen) - Use question words like wer, was, wo

## Yes/No Questions: Verb First

For yes/no questions, simply put the verb FIRST:

<VocabCard
  word="Liebst du mich?"
  translation="Do you love me?"
  pronunciation="[leepst doo mikh]"
  example="Statement: Du liebst mich. ‚Üí Question: Liebst du mich?"
/>

### Structure: Verb + Subject + Rest

| Statement | Yes/No Question |
|-----------|-----------------|
| Du bist m√ºde | **Bist** du m√ºde? |
| Ihr kommt heute | **Kommt** ihr heute? |
| Er hat Zeit | **Hat** er Zeit? |
| Wir gehen aus | **Gehen** wir aus? |

<VocabCard
  word="Hast du Hunger?"
  translation="Are you hungry?"
  pronunciation="[hahst doo HOONG-er]"
  example="A useful question for date night planning!"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="M√∂chtest du mit mir tanzen?"
  translation="Would you like to dance with me?"
  pronunciation="[MERKH-test doo mit meer TAHN-tsen]"
  example="A romantic invitation at any party."
/>

### Essential Yes/No Questions for Couples

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| Geht es dir gut? | Are you okay? |
| Bist du bereit? | Are you ready? |
| Hast du Zeit? | Do you have time? |
| Kommst du mit? | Are you coming along? |
| Gef√§llt es dir? | Do you like it? |
| Vermisst du mich? | Do you miss me? |

<CultureTip title="German Directness" flag="üá©üá™">
Germans appreciate direct questions. Unlike in some cultures, asking "Bist du sauer?" (Are you upset?) directly isn't considered rude - it's valued as honest communication.
</CultureTip>

## W-Questions: The Question Words

German question words all start with "W" (like English who, what, where, etc.):

### The Essential W-Words

<VocabCard
  word="Wer?"
  translation="Who?"
  pronunciation="[vehr]"
  example="Wer bist du? - Who are you?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Was?"
  translation="What?"
  pronunciation="[vahs]"
  example="Was machst du? - What are you doing?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wo?"
  translation="Where?"
  pronunciation="[voh]"
  example="Wo bist du? - Where are you?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wann?"
  translation="When?"
  pronunciation="[vahn]"
  example="Wann kommst du? - When are you coming?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Warum?"
  translation="Why?"
  pronunciation="[vah-ROOM]"
  example="Warum l√§chelst du? - Why are you smiling?"
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wie?"
  translation="How?"
  pronunciation="[vee]"
  example="Wie geht es dir? - How are you?"
/>

### Complete W-Word Reference

| Question Word | Meaning | Example Question |
|--------------|---------|------------------|
| wer | who | Wer hat angerufen? |
| was | what | Was denkst du? |
| wo | where (location) | Wo wohnst du? |
| wohin | where to (direction) | Wohin gehen wir? |
| woher | where from | Woher kommst du? |
| wann | when | Wann treffen wir uns? |
| warum | why | Warum bist du traurig? |
| wie | how | Wie findest du das? |
| wie viel | how much | Wie viel kostet das? |
| wie viele | how many | Wie viele Jahre seid ihr zusammen? |
| welcher/welche/welches | which | Welches Restaurant magst du? |
| wessen | whose | Wessen Tasche ist das? |

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Wie war dein Tag?"
  translation="How was your day?"
  pronunciation="[vee var dine tahk]"
  context="The perfect evening question to show you care about your partner's daily life."
/>

## W-Question Structure: Question Word + Verb + Subject

<VocabCard
  word="Was m√∂chtest du essen?"
  translation="What would you like to eat?"
  pronunciation="[vahs MERKH-test doo ES-sen]"
  example="W-word (Was) + Verb (m√∂chtest) + Subject (du) + Rest (essen)"
/>

### Romantic W-Questions

| German | English |
|--------|---------|
| Was denkst du? | What are you thinking? |
| Wie f√ºhlst du dich? | How do you feel? |
| Woran denkst du? | What are you thinking about? |
| Worauf freust du dich? | What are you looking forward to? |
| Wie habe ich dich verdient? | How did I deserve you? |
| Warum bist du so wunderbar? | Why are you so wonderful? |

## Wo, Wohin, Woher: Location Questions

German distinguishes between location (wo), destination (wohin), and origin (woher):

<VocabCard
  word="Wo bist du?"
  translation="Where are you?"
  pronunciation="[voh bist doo]"
  example="Asking about current location."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wohin gehst du?"
  translation="Where are you going (to)?"
  pronunciation="[voh-HIN gayst doo]"
  example="Asking about destination."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Woher kommst du?"
  translation="Where are you from?"
  pronunciation="[voh-HAIR komst doo]"
  example="Asking about origin."
/>

<CultureTip title="Wohin in Spoken German" flag="üá©üá™">
In casual speech, Germans often split wohin: "Wo gehst du hin?" instead of "Wohin gehst du?" Both are correct, but the split version is more conversational.
</CultureTip>

## Wie + Adjective Combinations

"Wie" combines with adjectives to ask about degree or extent:

| German | English | Example |
|--------|---------|---------|
| wie alt | how old | Wie alt bist du? |
| wie lange | how long | Wie lange bist du schon hier? |
| wie oft | how often | Wie oft denkst du an mich? |
| wie weit | how far | Wie weit ist es bis zum Restaurant? |
| wie sp√§t | what time | Wie sp√§t ist es? |
| wie gro√ü | how tall/big | Wie gro√ü bist du? |

<VocabCard
  word="Wie lange sind wir schon zusammen?"
  translation="How long have we been together?"
  pronunciation="[vee LAHNG-eh zint veer shohn tsoo-ZAM-men]"
  example="Perfect for anniversary reflections!"
/>

## Welcher/Welche/Welches: Which One?

"Which" changes based on gender and case:

| Gender | Nominative | Accusative | Dative |
|--------|------------|------------|--------|
| Masculine | welcher | welchen | welchem |
| Feminine | welche | welche | welcher |
| Neuter | welches | welches | welchem |
| Plural | welche | welche | welchen |

<VocabCard
  word="Welchen Film m√∂chtest du sehen?"
  translation="Which movie would you like to see?"
  pronunciation="[VEL-khen film MERKH-test doo ZAY-en]"
  example="Welchen (accusative masculine) because Film is masculine."
/>

## Indirect Questions

When embedding a question inside another sentence, use question words but change the word order (verb at the end):

<VocabCard
  word="Ich frage mich, warum du so sch√∂n bist"
  translation="I wonder why you are so beautiful"
  pronunciation="[ikh FRAH-geh mikh vah-ROOM doo zoh shern bist]"
  example="In the indirect question, 'bist' goes to the end."
/>

### Examples of Indirect Questions

| Direct Question | Indirect Question |
|-----------------|-------------------|
| Wo wohnt er? | Wei√üt du, wo er wohnt? |
| Was macht sie? | Ich wei√ü nicht, was sie macht |
| Wann kommt der Zug? | K√∂nnen Sie mir sagen, wann der Zug kommt? |

<VocabCard
  word="Kannst du mir sagen, wo das Restaurant ist?"
  translation="Can you tell me where the restaurant is?"
  pronunciation="[kahnst doo meer ZAH-gen voh dahs res-tow-RAHNT ist]"
  example="Polite way to ask for directions."
/>

## Question Tags

German uses different phrases to turn statements into questions:

| Tag | Meaning | Example |
|-----|---------|---------|
| oder? | right? | Du kommst doch, oder? |
| nicht wahr? | isn't it? | Das ist sch√∂n, nicht wahr? |
| stimmt's? | right? | Wir treffen uns um 8, stimmt's? |
| ja? | yeah? | Du liebst mich, ja? |

<VocabCard
  word="Das war ein sch√∂ner Abend, oder?"
  translation="That was a nice evening, wasn't it?"
  pronunciation="[dahs var ine SHER-ner AH-bent OH-der]"
  example="A sweet way to confirm shared feelings."
/>

## Practice Activities for Couples

### Activity 1: 20 Questions
Play 20 questions in German! One person thinks of something, the other asks yes/no questions:
- Ist es ein Tier? (Is it an animal?)
- Kann man es essen? (Can you eat it?)

### Activity 2: W-Question Chain
Take turns asking W-questions about each other's day:
- Was hast du gemacht?
- Wen hast du getroffen?
- Wo warst du?

### Activity 3: First Date Reenactment
Pretend you're meeting for the first time and practice first-date questions:
- Wie hei√üt du?
- Was machst du beruflich?
- Was sind deine Hobbys?

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Darf ich dich etwas fragen?"
  translation="May I ask you something?"
  pronunciation="[darf ikh dikh ET-vahs FRAH-gen]"
  context="A polite way to introduce an important question."
/>

## Common Question Mistakes

1. **Forgetting to move the verb first** in yes/no questions
2. **Using wrong word order** in indirect questions (verb should go to end)
3. **Confusing wo/wohin/woher** - location vs. direction vs. origin
4. **Wrong welcher form** - remember gender and case

## Building Your Question Skills

Questions are the heart of conversation. By mastering German questions, you and your partner can have deeper, more meaningful exchanges. Start with simple yes/no questions, add W-questions gradually, and soon you'll be asking anything in German!

Remember: there are no stupid questions, only learning opportunities. Practice asking each other questions daily, and your German fluency will grow naturally.

<CTA text="Ready to ask anything in German?" buttonText="Start Learning Now" />
